description: Manage files in Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 account.

commands.name: az storage fs file append
commands.summary: Append content to a file in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file append --content
                          --file-system
                          --path
                          [--account-key]
                          [--account-name]
                          [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                          [--blob-endpoint]
                          [--connection-string]
                          [--sas-token]
                          [--timeout]
examples: az storage fs file append --content "test content test" -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file create
commands.summary: Create a new file in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file create --file-system
                          --path
                          [--account-key]
                          [--account-name]
                          [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                          [--blob-endpoint]
                          [--connection-string]
                          [--content-cache]
                          [--content-disposition]
                          [--content-encoding]
                          [--content-language]
                          [--content-md5]
                          [--content-type]
                          [--metadata]
                          [--permissions]
                          [--sas-token]
                          [--timeout]
                          [--umask]
examples: az storage fs file create -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file delete
commands.summary: Delete a file in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file delete --file-system
                          --path
                          [--account-key]
                          [--account-name]
                          [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                          [--blob-endpoint]
                          [--connection-string]
                          [--sas-token]
                          [--timeout]
                          [--yes]
examples: az storage fs file delete -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file download
commands.summary: Download a file from the specified path in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file download --file-system
                            --path
                            [--account-key]
                            [--account-name]
                            [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                            [--blob-endpoint]
                            [--connection-string]
                            [--destination]
                            [--overwrite {false, true}]
                            [--sas-token]
                            [--timeout]
examples: az storage fs file download -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file download -p dir/a.txt -d test/ -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file download -p dir/a.txt -d test/b.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file exists
commands.summary: Check for the existence of a file in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file exists --file-system
                          --path
                          [--account-key]
                          [--account-name]
                          [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                          [--blob-endpoint]
                          [--connection-string]
                          [--sas-token]
                          [--timeout]
examples: az storage fs file exists -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file list
commands.summary: List files and directories in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file list --file-system
                        [--account-key]
                        [--account-name]
                        [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                        [--blob-endpoint]
                        [--connection-string]
                        [--exclude-dir]
                        [--marker]
                        [--num-results]
                        [--path]
                        [--recursive {false, true}]
                        [--sas-token]
                        [--show-next-marker]
                        [--timeout]
examples: az storage fs file list -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file list --exclude-dir -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file list --path dir -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file list --marker "VBaS6LvPufaqrTANTQvbmV3dHJ5FgAAAA==" -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file move
commands.summary: Move a file in ADLS Gen2 Account.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file move --file-system
                        --new-path
                        --path
                        [--account-key]
                        [--account-name]
                        [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                        [--blob-endpoint]
                        [--connection-string]
                        [--content-cache]
                        [--content-disposition]
                        [--content-encoding]
                        [--content-language]
                        [--content-md5]
                        [--content-type]
                        [--sas-token]
examples: az storage fs file move --new-path new-fs/new-dir/b.txt -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000

commands.name: az storage fs file set-expiry
commands.summary: Sets the time a file will expire and be deleted.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file set-expiry --expiry-options {Absolute, NeverExpire, RelativeToCreation, RelativeToNow}
                              --file-system
                              --path
                              [--account-key]
                              [--account-name]
                              [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                              [--blob-endpoint]
                              [--connection-string]
                              [--expires-on]
                              [--sas-token]
                              [--timeout]

commands.name: az storage fs file show
commands.summary: Show properties of file in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file show --file-system
                        --path
                        [--account-key]
                        [--account-name]
                        [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                        [--blob-endpoint]
                        [--connection-string]
                        [--sas-token]
                        [--timeout]
examples: az storage fs file show -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
az storage fs file show --account-name myadlsaccount --auth-mode login --file-system fsname --path dir/a.txt

commands.name: az storage fs file upload
commands.summary: Upload a file to a file path in ADLS Gen2 file system.
commands.syntax:
az storage fs file upload --file-system
                          --path
                          --source
                          [--account-key]
                          [--account-name]
                          [--auth-mode {key, login}]
                          [--blob-endpoint]
                          [--connection-string]
                          [--content-cache]
                          [--content-disposition]
                          [--content-encoding]
                          [--content-language]
                          [--content-md5]
                          [--content-type]
                          [--if-match]
                          [--if-modified-since]
                          [--if-none-match]
                          [--if-unmodified-since]
                          [--metadata]
                          [--overwrite {false, true}]
                          [--permissions]
                          [--sas-token]
                          [--timeout]
                          [--umask]
examples: az storage fs file upload --source a.txt -p dir/a.txt -f fsname --account-name myadlsaccount --account-key 0000-0000
